newsitem.title: USA: Woolworth sees Q1 beating estimates.
newsitem.headline: Woolworth sees Q1 beating estimates.

text.p: Woolworth Corp said it expects first-quarter earnings to beat current expectations.
The company did not specify what those expectations were, but the First Call consensus estimate from five analysts forecast a net loss of $0.06 per share for the quarter, which ended in April.

Woolowrth said that although sales were lower than anticipated during the final four to six weeks of the quarter, it still expects year-over- year improvement, reflecting aggressive implementation of its ongoing strategic initiatives.

Excluding the effect of translation rates, particularly as it relates to the company's German operations, and of businesses disposed of during 1996 and 1997, Woolworth said sales for the four week period ended May 3 remained unchanged while sales for the thirteen week period increased 1.1 percent.
